Learn Some Spanish

Live Repo

Si Senor  is an app that lets you memorize spanish words. Allowing you to see words you don't understand more often than the words you already know. This app uses React, MongoDB, Express, and mocha, chai, enzyme and, jest. You can find the repo here.

 

CHALLENGES

The biggest challenge was seeing if we can implement a algorithm that showed wrong answers more often than right:

  • started simple, used an array and pushed back the answer if the user answered correctly
  • We later used a linked list that moved instead of an array
  • The final algorithm we used was a linked list that used a memory value to push the word m spots if correct and push the 1 spot if answered wrong

After figuring out the algorithm all we had to do on the client side was:

  • Create word card
  • Create login form
  • Create sign up form
 

SOLUTIONS

The first thing we did was create the algorithm and a basic client side. Once the algorithm was working properly we started working on the client side. We decided to just have a card that gets updated dynamically. The card also shows you how many questions you have answered so far.

 

RESULTS

It was really fun working with a partner. You can find his github profile here. We worked on the front end and back end evenly, I hope i get to work with him again.

One of the best things about being a web developer is, new technologies come out and make the developing more interesting. You'll never be bored. Also, the feeling that you can work as a team, create an app that will help multiple people is one of the best feelings I have ever felt. When i'm not developing I also love doing anything that is competitive, building and fixing computers, and hanging out with friends.
